name: Golden Parnassus Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just got back from four days at GP and are already planning a return trip next fall. We chose this place randomly, looking for an inexpensive resort close to the airport for our first trip to Cancun and we lucked out, the staff and other guests were fun, the food was good and the atmosphere was great. We travel quite a bit and were not disappointed with the room, the food and drink, the staff or the beach, but we aren't complainers either. You need to be flexible to have fun and go with the flow, but nothing went wrong with our stay. We felt like we found a home there after just a few hours, everyone was friendly and filled us in on what we needed to know about the hotel and Cancun. Many guests had been there several times and that's a pretty good recommendation. The fact that there weren't any kids there made it even better but there wasn't much risque behavior, just a few topless sunbathers on the beach, so we didn't feel uncomfortable. We may have just hit it right this time but I suspect it is always fun.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a week at this hotel and were ready to come home! This was our second trip to Mexico and we were very disappointed with this resort. The room service never seemed to get our order correct and they would leave the dirty dishes in the hall all day long so ants and other insects were crawling on the plates. The resort itself was pretty and aside from the dirty dishes, they were mostly clean. Our room, however, had dirty sheets placed on the bed twice during our stay and we had to ask for our coffee to be replaced everyday. They would not replace our coffee cups, so we had to drink it from the glass cups they give you for water. The bartenders were pretty awesome, however, and made up for some of the issues we were having. THe beach is gorgeous and the pool was very nice, but cold. Not much privacy at the hotel but it was located close to shopping and the airport. The food was ok, the buffet was pretty typical, nothing to rave about. The mid-day activities and the billiards were fun. The management was pretty awful, had a couple of issues and was basically told to "stay somewhere else". I guess you get what you pay for and it's a pretty inexpensive rate. I wouldn't stay here again, but if it's in your price range and you are looking for a place to party a lot, go for it!
reviews.title: Would not return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned from the Golden Parnassus Resort Oct 4, 2012 , it is adult only ,all inclusive resort. The staff are the best we ever had in any resort. they tell you tipping is not nessasary but a few dollars go a very long way . The food was excellent even the beef ! The rooms are very nice , airconditioning worked great ,everything is very clean , The bars are very good ,the beach is perfect, the lobby is open air also very nice. My wife left her glasses at the beach we thought they were gone , but they were returned to front desk , this did not happen at other resorts we stayed at. The grounds are very nice , pool and hot tub very good . Nightly entertainment was very good once again the staff is excellent. Daytime entertainment is so so could use some work. We have been to Cancun many times and this was one of our best experiences. We will return to this resort ! Once again the STAFF are EXCEPTIONAL!!
reviews.title: York South Carolinia , Great Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our 6 day vacation here and will return next year. It was not too expensive so I didn't have high expectations. However, the hotel and rooms are very clean and comfortable, staff is awesome, food is good, drinks are great. One of the most relaxing vacations I've had. By the way, other guest are also wonderful and you'll make many friends.
reviews.title: Great vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we booked this with our friends, they had told us that this place was nothing "fancy", just tons of fun, and they were right. The resort itself if not one of the glitzy places, just comfortable and fun and clean. We were there a week. The food was very good for an all inclusive, the staff were incredibly friendly and fun. Everyone who worked there continually asked if you needed anything. Bartenders were a blast. I do think the drinks are a bit weak. Not sure why. We did tip the waiters, bartenders and maids, which they truly appreciate.
reviews.title: Fun Time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I am a travel agent from Vancouver, and I just returned from a one week stay at the Golden with my best friend. I was very pleased with the trip in general. The service was excellent. Oscar and Gerardo in the buffet restaurant were incredible. I thought that entertainment staff Luciana,Angel,Daniel, and Carlos kept busy trying to keep things interesting and were very friendly and informative. Carlos at the outside bar was fantastic and we had the best waitress outside by the pool every single day....and I am so upset that I cannot remember her name. The resort was a $10 taxi ride to all the clubs....or $1 on the bus. I cannot stress how clean the resort was, and how beautiful the beach was. Overall I would rate this resort an eight out of ten. The only reason being that the food was great at the all night snack bar and buffet, but a little lacking for me at the other restaurants.
reviews.title: Great service, and overall good time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD:
reviews.title: No major complaints. Fun time, not too large like others

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Old Barn was great! I had heard about the New York Strip as being the best, but we really liked the Filet Mignon better. Definitely get the nachos; they are great.
reviews.title: Amazing holiday-Rob & Amanda England!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -ShangriLa was pretty amazing. It is closed on Mondays so plan accordingly, but it's worth donning a pair of pants (guys) and closed toed shoes to attend. Food was fantastic; service was second to none!
reviews.title: Best Birthday Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010
reviews.text: -Buffet was pretty decent. Anything with grilled chicken in it will probably taste pretty similar....but the pasta was pretty good. Don't forget your ice cream! Also, for lunch, we headed over to the Golden Parnassus one day and ate at the Mexican place there which was really good.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Cancun for my wife and I, we weren't sure what to expect. We were looking for a break after a long Alberta winter. All I can say is the resort was excellent! Very friendly staff, good food and great service. Very clean, they seem to clean all the time day or night. The house keeping staff was friendly and always had our room up to par, and I am very picky about that sort of stuff!! I spend alot of nights in a hotel room for work. The bartenders at the Tiki bar were excellent, lots of laughs there on a daily basis. If your looking for nightlife, the hotel staff will accompany you to a different club each night downtown Cancun. Don't miss the trip to Coco Bongo, the absolute best club I have ever been to, now matter what age group your in!!!
reviews.title: EXCELLENT STAY, GREAT FOOD AND SERVICE!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall great time, met lots of good people during our stay!!!
reviews.title: Another fantastic time at the Parnassuss!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second trip to the Parnassus. Stayed March 2 to March 10. We had no problems with check-in and our rooms were spotless as usual. The staff do an amazing job of keeping the hotel and surrounding grounds clean at all times. There is always a beehive of activity in the background as they are continually cleaning the grounds and restocking the bars and restaurants. Not obtrusive to your stay at all.
reviews.title: Great Time/Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food was very good in most restaurants although a couple of times the appetizers could have been hotter. Service is always first rate! Make sure that you tip like you would at home as they work very hard to make sure that you are satisfied. Shangri La and Sumo were our favourites. The buffet always has a great selection of food for breakfast and lunch. You definitely won't starve at this resort.
reviews.title: Honest Review of The Golden Parnassus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The beach area has been expanded with the restoration project and it allows for beach volleyball and beach soccer. There was always someone out there playing in the sand! The water is very warm and inviting so go frolic for a while in the beautiful Caribbean Sea!
reviews.title: Loved it and will be returning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The GP is a wonderful vacation for adults who enjoy the smaller resort advantages: staff is very attentive and helpful, guests are friendly and fun, "entertainment" staff is enthusiastic, good restaurant choices, pool area and beach are beautiful, and the bartenders are terrific! This is a place for adults who are not critical about every little thing in a resort. All ages of singles/couples return here for the atmosphere and service. Great place to relax (and gain a few pounds! Ha,ha!) There are also tours, snorkeling, fishing, etc to do in the area- lots of fun stuff! One more thing..you can take a shuttle to GP's sister resort, The Great Parnassus- a mile away-, if you want to eat there or use their facilities . Be forewarned though....this is a "family" resort. (lost of kids!) Most guests go there to "check it out" but return to the Golden for the adults-only peacefulness.
reviews.title: Second time here - still wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a one year absence (we stayed at the Accidental Xcarrot in Playa del Carmen last summer - yuk) we returned to the Golden Parnassus in Cancun from 6/23/11 to 6/30/11. We have indeed found our go-to hotel in Mexico. This is the most affordable all adult hotel that we have found in Cancun. The owner(s) have made several upgrades since we stayed here in 2009. The things we noticed were exterior paint, upgraded bathrooms, relocation of the lobby bar, deletion of the minature golf course with the addition of new shops, and probably 3x as much sand on the beach as there was last time.
reviews.title: once again, a great vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a 7:00 AM flight from Houston, so we arrived at the hotel at 10:00AM. We were seated in the lobby and greeted with a great adult frozen beverage. Check-in time is 3:00PM and they strictly adhere to this, so don't keep going up to the front desk and bother the desk staff. (Tip - Pack one of your bathing suits and some suntan lotion to where you can get to it easily in your suitcase.) They immediately give you your wrist band and towel cards. After changing into a bathing suit (or not) you can lay at the pool or on the beach or access the bars or restaurant. You just got here!! Who wants to sit in a hotel room??
reviews.title: Was not at all what I expected, very disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: The restaurants - We found all 5 restaurants to be quite excellent. Breakfast is served buffet style with omlette and waffle/pancake stations in the Paradise restaurant. The dinners are served in the other four restaurants and all are a la carte. Lunch is served poolside at the Breeze for hamburgers and fries or the Paradise for a buffet lunch. I found lunch at the Paradise to be a hidden gem. Great food, and Javier and the guys will really take care of you.
reviews.title: We'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bars - Never had a chance to visit the Dolphin Bar on the beach, but the Beer Garden, the Sixties bar , and the Tiki Bar at the pool were all excellent. No cheap liqour here folks - Bicardi Anejo, Absolut vodka, just as an example. Jose', Alfonso, Carlos, and Perfecto are the best bartenders you'll find anywhere. Ask Jose' for a Pepper Shot! And while laying by the pool, Karen always kept our glasses full.
reviews.title: Just o.k.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are frequent all inclusive travelers in our 30's. We love going to Mexico as it really is the best value. Every resort we stay at has its pros and cons, but some really stand out as better or worse than others. Overall, the Golden Parnassus is in the better column.
reviews.title: Just what we needed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: 3 stars. Exactly what they advertise and you should expect
Honeymoon Sstay
reviews.text: The size of the resort was perfect. Easy to get around and make friends. Not so big that you get lost in the shuffle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No reservations for the restaurants at night. The food was only good though. I have had better in this category, but it was still good and we were satisfied. We actually prefer going to a big buffet for our night time dinner, and there was not one here. We did have exchange priviledges with the Great Parnassus though, so we went to their buffet one night and it was good. Shangra La was good for the food, but not the service. I liked the Old Barn, but many others theer didn't like it including my wife. Pier 12 was decent. The Sumo was good, but very slow service.
reviews.title: Loved Cancun! You get what you pay for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were decent. Again, I've had better, but I've also had worse. The shower worked great and was very roomy compared to most. Nice TVs and big balconys. Our room had a lagoon view which was nice, because as the sun went down on the ocean side, we had sun for another hour or two. Plus we could watch the sunset. Yes the beds are hard, but the pillows were good which made up for it. Yes it is loud at night, but turn the fan on and it drowns it out.
reviews.title: Golden Parnassus Does Allow Spring Breakers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I first time out of the country- with friends who come to Cancun every year almost so we had great guides. The hotel was always clean, the staff were always friendly and helpful and just plain fun to chit-chat with. The food was "OK", not impressed with The Barn as our steaks all different cuts looked the same...and the color gray at that - BUT, the drinks were great and the staff were lovely. Loved the crepe' bar open from 5-8 each night that had a coffee/espresso machine handy 24/7. The bars both inside and on the beach were good, the bartenders were a hoot! The beach was sparkling clean, the pool was never overly crowded and the waitstaff were always attentive- we would most definitely come back here. We met a ton of nice people from around the world.
reviews.title: First Timers - But with experienced friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from our first trip and Cancun and I must say we picked a fantastic hotel! We are already planning to come back and bring friends with us! Loved the food, Shangri-la was the best. The bartenders were some of the best I have ever seen and always kept your drinks coming and the party going. The entertainment team always had plenty of activities during the day, tequila volleyball was my favorite! The beach was beautiful and clean. Our room was always clean and I loved the large walk in shower. The only complaints I have which are very few is that the hot tub was not warm at all but it was never cool enough for me to want to get in anyways, the computers didnt work most of the time and were pretty expensive to use, the front desk staff were sometimes rude but only certain people. Overall, we had an amazing vacation and will def. come back and recommend it to our friends and family. Dont believe the other reviews!
reviews.title: Had a wonderful time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just came back from our second trip to Golden, and we are already trying to plan our next. Don't listen to people that may say this place isn't worth it. It is!! Those people are probably chronic complainers that were born with silver spoons. They would probably complain if they were being hung with a brand new rope...
reviews.title: Don't be misled by the bad reviews!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Is this the newest, biggest and nicest resort on the strip? No, not at all. Is ALL the food five star dining? No, I don't think so.... However, the staff, and the effort they put forth is amazing. This is a smaller, older, adults only resort that has a great spot on the beach. The staff is constantly cleaning, and I never felt like I was at a dirty resort. Don't mistake older for dirty. This isn't a new and shiny place. The staff works very hard to keep it in the best shape. Just watch Juvencio (goes by Theo) work. He is 72 years old, and works outside keeping things tidy. He can outwork most people I know.
reviews.title: Feels like going on vacation with 100 of your most fun friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food is wonderful. Visit Gama, Samuel, Pasqual, and Oscar in the buffet for breakfast or lunch. If you are not pleased with the service and smile you receive, then you don't have a pulse. And there are plenty of food options to choose from. Don't forget, you're not at home. Things tatse and look different at times. That doesn't mean they are bad. Check out the breeze around 11:00 am. They put out the BEST chips, salsa and guac. You can also get burgers and other things there. Our favorite place to eat is the French restaurant at the sister resort, but the Old Barn and Shangri La do a very nice job as well. If you can't find food you like at this resort, you are probably the people that complain to the manager every time you go out to eat. Do everyone a favor and stay home.
reviews.title: Great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Cancun and the Golden Parnassus was a great place for us! From the staff to the food to the beach and off site tours - it was a special vacation! We are not very fussy travelers and if there were any "negatives" we just laughed them off! We enjoyed being in an all-inclusive resort, and we met some nice people at the pool/bar area. The beach was beautiful and the ocean water was not too cold! We ate at their "best" restaurant every night - top notch food and staff!
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to this resort for 4 nights to celebrate my birthday and had a fantastic time!
reviews.title: Great time for Fantastic Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WOW’s: I e-mailed the hotel beforehand to let them know it was my birthday and confirm my room type and that day found a Happy Birthday cake left in my room which was so nice!
reviews.title: Great Service- Very Friendly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also-someone literally gave us the shirt off their back! We were walking through the lobby and Ruben (Guest Services) asked us how our stay was going and we told him things were great and mentioned that my boyfriend forgot a collared shirt to go to Shangri La for dinner and he goes "You can have mine!" And took it off and gave it to us and said it was clean we can return when we were done. Worked out great!
reviews.title: Great Stay - Would do it again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, big shout out to Fermin in the Beer Garden (ask for the blue shot!) and Noemi our always cheerful housekeeper. Annette at the AquaWorld Counter was wonderful as well. She did our resort course for scuba diving and was really fun and informative.
reviews.title: Great Stay. Don't be scared by the bad reviews, great stay at the Golden.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were greeted by the bellboys and front staff and served the house drink (The Parnassus) while getting us checked in and made to feel welcome. Thru our stay, we found all the staff were friendly, full of energy and always ready to assist us. I wish my spanish was as good as their english.
reviews.title: great holiday locale in the Hotel Zone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are modern and well cared for. Beds are comfortable and there were always clean towels. The air works really well. We had an oceanview room with a balcony. Great view but a little toasty in the morning. A lagune view would have allowed us to sit on the balcony for our morning coffee a little longer and we could have watched the sunset from our balcony.The hotel is done as six levels and has an elevator. There are no fridges provided in the room. They are included in the suites but are extra in the regular rooms.There is an onsite variety store and the prices were not out of line. Prices could be given in pesos and US dollars.
reviews.title: first time in Cancun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The beach is reached by a series of stairs. Stairs from the front lobby are wide and not steep but are about 20. This first set takes you to the pool. Next there are another set of stairs or a wide ramp to the beach. A lifeguard was there most of the day and there is a bar on the beach as well. Lots of beach chairs and some permanent umbellas there as well. Red flags were up most of our stay as the undertow was quite strong. We did swim a couple of our days and the bottom was sandy.
reviews.title: Hands down THE best service at an all inclusive resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There is a bar near the pool on that level, as well as a bar in the lobby and when it closes the bar in the sixties bar. We found the activities in the evening after the theatre show at 9, was more to market the outside bars (Sweet Club, Coco Bongo, etc) than to organize anything in their bar.The exception was Halloween.There were pool tables in the sixties bar, along with tables if you wanted a game of cards, etc. Thruout the day, there was always an activity you could choose to do. The entertainment crew always did their best to get us doing something. Watch out for the tequila games. Darts was deadly. We found that some of the activities gave times but no locations and the staff are going to fix that right away. If you want a real workout, karen said that the aquafit was the best she has ever done for feeling the burn.
reviews.title: What a deal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were lots of food choices at the morning and lunch buffet. No buffet for supper as you have the a la cartes at this resort and the Great Parnassus, which is a 10 minute shuttle ride from this resort. The shuttle runs every hour until 10pm. We ate Sumo (Japanese) twice and tried to leave room for the deep fried icecream. The Old Barn is their steakhouse. The prime rib is excellent. Pier 12 offers variety and is sometimes open for lunch or supper. The Shangri-la was their fine dining and did have a dress code. The Breeze was their poolside munchies and their nachos and cheese are to die for. It is open from 11am to 6am. Food was excellent in all the restaurants and special thanks to Victor, our waiter for three of our evening dining experiences. PS. They enforce pants, collared shirt and close toe shoes for the men in their fine dining location, but seem pretty easy on what the women wear.
reviews.title: Solid 4 Star Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Two years ago, we went to the Golden as a group of six. This month, we returned as a group of ten. This hotel is still one of the best we have been to in terms of value for the cost. I like the smaller resorts so this is a perfect fit for me. I also like being close to a town, so again, a great fit. All the returning friends and the new ones LOVED it!
reviews.title: Second time and still great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This time we went to Chichen Itza. Since it was my sixth time in Mexico, I figured it was about time! We paid $99 each and got a full day on a comfortable bus. They picked us up right after breakfast, served coffee, juice, and pastries. We stopped at a Cenote first. Many of our group took in the diving and swimming. Then off the the buffet lunch, which was included. Lastly, a tour with guide of the ruins. You are supposed to sleep on the bus on the way home but the beer was flowing so we stayed awake. The service was fantastic! A very well spent day. We booked this with our Signature rep at the hotel.
reviews.title: Worst experience ever - from staff to facilities/amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We also went to Coco Bongo this time. Last time we went to Margaritaville and The City. Coco Bongo was arranged with the entertainment staff at the resort. They can take you any night. We paid $60 for the transportation down, VIP table, and our own waiter. This place is a must see-but arrange it with your entertainment staff!! We had the table closest to the stage. Google this place if you don't know what it is. My best description is dance club meets Vegas show with a bit of Cirque de Soleil thrown in. It is fantastic!!
reviews.title: Possibly the worst hotel I've ever experienced....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We usually hit Senor Frogs and Carlos and Charlies. We hit SF for a drink and C&C for dinner. We spent about $100 for dinner for two, and two rounds of large drinks each. You must do dinner in this place. It was every bit as good as Coco Bongo for entertainment value and was more interactive. Our friends who had never experienced it before had the best time there!!!
reviews.title: WOW, JUST WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now, for the hotel: Staff just as great as I remember (Pasqual for buffet! Edith for waitress in lobby bar! Fonzie for drinks at the pool bar!). Service in steak house was pretty good, one night was a two hour wait though! and the steaks were good but not as good as they were two years ago. Seafood just as good as I remember and we forgot until near the end that they are also open for lunch from 1-5. Japanese was okay, food was good, but our waiter was off that night-service was not so great. Shangri La did a great job-it is a fancy five course meal so be prepared to spend some time and enjoy the experience. Menus change every Wed so where you go early in the week can be repeated later for different food. Grill is always good-burgers are great! All a la carte for evening meals with no reservations. Even with our group of ten, we seldom had to wait long.
reviews.title: Sad - Second Trip to the Golden P in 14 months

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this was a smaller resort bartenders all staff were just great!!!!!! food good!!!!!! feel in love on our 10 avn all over again the best!!!! hot peppers in the tequila u have to try it!!!!!!!!! we were not even charged for lost of extras massage etc they just love us CANADIANS!!!!!! cant wait 2 go back!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: oh my this is the place to go LOVE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for the first week of October. We arrived on a Sunday around 3pm with another British couple, we were greeted warmly, seated and given a cocktail while our bags were taken up to our room.
reviews.title: Excellent holiday, fabulous staff - didn't want to leave!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spotless and spacious, it had 2 beds that weren't singles but weren't quite doubles either, this was my only disappointment. There was room for two to sleep in them but after getting sunburned on the first day we slept in a bed each the next night as it would've been just too cosy in one.
reviews.title: Best service anywhere!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The balcony was nice with a view of the lagoon and the front on the hotel.
reviews.title: Great time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom was spotless and shower powerful however the water was not cold even on the coldest setting which only mattered when I was cleaning my teeth in the sink.
reviews.title: Very Nice Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and the boyfriend went to the golden parnassus from 10th june- 22nd june! we had an amazing time!
reviews.title: TERRIFIC!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: arrival- couldnt complain! we arrived and got greeted with a cold wet hand cloth and a welcoming cocktail whilst we were waiting for our check in wrist bands and card for the room! they took our suitcases up to our room by the time we got there so everything was fab!
reviews.title: Good as Usual

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: room- we only booked the basic but if im going to be completely honest, at first i was a bit unsure but when i put everythin into perspective i realised that the room was extremely clean and there wasnt really anythig wrong with it! it was absolutely fine and i wudnt have wasted any money just for a sea view and jacuzzi! the bathrooms were lovely and the beds were comfy! there was enough space and a lovely balcony! no complaints! the maid was wonderful!
reviews.title: Great Concept, Needs Improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: pool- in my opinion, perhaps was big enough! but was still really good and was clean! its not very deep either. its great tho as because its adult only, the pool is open til 11pm! not many people, if any swim at this time. there is a jacuzzi too.
reviews.title: Had a Great Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Beach- SPECTACULAR! never been to such an amazing beach (iv been to the maldives aswell so im not lieing) the sand is so soft and the sea is crystal clear. no need for water shoes! beautiful <3
reviews.title: 4 guys, ages ranging from 20-23, our opinion!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small hotel with good food and good service but not the amenities of a larger complex. The breakfast/lunch buffet had very good food and exceptional service. Lots of choices! Other guests had recommended the Sumo restaurant. I think we went on an off night. Appetizer served after main meal - not the best food or service. The Old Barn had wonderful steaks and good service. The Breezes snack bar had a very good cheeseburger. Pier 12 had wonderful service but found the shrimp dish swimming in oil - it was just not to my taste. Bar service was good except when it rained - the hotel closed the two bars by the pool and beach. There was a large group (about 20 people) in the hot tub when it was just sprinkling and no where to get a drink. We went to Pier 12 (the closest restaurant) but they were not helpful and said they "ran out of cups". So...to get a drink, it was a long walk up through the lobby to the Beer Garden bar.
reviews.title: Good Food and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was ok. High winds made for a noisy whistling sound in the room. We finally figured out that if we left the balcony door opened an inch, the whistling noise went away! Beautiful ocean view from the 5th floor. HATED the LED lighting in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Great stay
Just okay - Definitely no "WOW" factor here!
reviews.text: The beach looked lovely but unfortunately we had terrible weather the entire 4 days we were there with high winds and torrential rains. The red flags meant no swimming in the ocean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Missed having a swim up bar and nightly shows of a larger resort but loved that this place was adults only! We could have gone to the sister resort - Great Parnassus - for more restaurants, etc but enjoyed the adults only aspect of the Golden Parnassus.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arranged for transport (prior to arriving) round trip to and from airport for $70 usd. We could have taken a taxi for $25 each way. The local bus is 1 usd and takes you just about any where quickly. The bus stop is a short walk down to the main road.
reviews.title: Great time, great people

description: Adults only. Formerly Golden Crown Paradise
